skill.name: sragent
skill.description:

genomics metadata using the SRAgent toolkit. Supports accession conversion (GSEâ†’SRXâ†’SRR), 
BigQuery metadata queries, manuscript downloads from multiple sources, and scRNA-seq 
technology identification. Use when working with SRA/GEO datasets, finding publications, 
or analyzing single-cell sequencing experiments.

security_audit.summary: All 413 static findings are false positives. The skill consists only of markdown documentation files. No executable code exists in this skill. The static analyzer incorrectly flagged markdown code block delimiters, example environment variable placeholders, and NCBI field names as security issues.

content.user_title: Query SRA databases and retrieve genomics papers
content.value_statement: SRAgent helps researchers work with NCBI Sequence Read Archive and GEO databases. It converts between accession formats, extracts metadata from sequencing experiments, and finds associated publications automatically.
actual_capabilities: Convert between SRA/GEO accession formats (GSE, SRP, SRX, SRR)
Extract metadata from sequencing experiments (platform, organism, technology)
Identify single-cell RNA-seq technologies (10X Genomics, Smart-seq)
Find and download publications linked to datasets
Query NCBI Entrez databases for dataset information
Process multiple accessions from CSV files
limitations: Requires SRAgent Python package installation for full functionality
BigQuery features require Google Cloud credentials
Paper downloads depend on open access availability
Rate limits apply to NCBI API requests without an API key

use_cases.title: Dataset metadata lookup
use_cases.description: Look up sequencing technology and library preparation details for a specific SRA experiment.

use_cases.title: Batch publication retrieval
use_cases.description: Download all papers associated with a list of SRA accessions from a CSV file.

use_cases.title: Technology identification
use_cases.description: Identify if a dataset is single-cell RNA-seq and which 10X Genomics chemistry was used.

prompt_templates.title: Simple accession lookup
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert GSE121737 to SRX accessions using SRAgent

prompt_templates.title: Metadata extraction
prompt_templates.prompt: What sequencing technology was used for experiment SRX4967527?

prompt_templates.title: Paper download
prompt_templates.prompt: Download all papers linked to study PRJNA498286

prompt_templates.title: Batch processing
prompt_templates.prompt: Process accessions.csv and download papers for each SRA experiment listed

output: All experiments are single-cell RNA-seq using 10X Genomics Chromium 3'
Found 2 PubMed IDs linked to this experiment
Yes, this study contains single-cell RNA-seq datasets
Technologies identified: 10X Genomics Chromium Single Cell 3' v3

best_practices: Install SRAgent Python package before using this skill
Set up NCBI_API_KEY for higher rate limits on Entrez queries
Use CSV input for batch processing multiple accessions
Check paper availability before relying on downloads
anti_patterns: Do not share API keys in prompts or conversation
Do not expect papers to download from paywalled journals
Do not assume all SRA experiments have linked publications
Do not run large batch operations without adjusting concurrency settings

faq.question: What is SRAgent?
faq.answer: SRAgent is a bioinformatics tool for querying NCBI Sequence Read Archive and GEO databases to find dataset metadata and associated publications.

faq.question: Do I need to install anything?
faq.answer: Yes, install the SRAgent Python package separately. This skill provides the interface and documentation for using it.

faq.question: What accessions can it convert?
faq.answer: SRAgent converts between GSE (GEO Series), SRP/PRJNA (Study), SRX/ERX (Experiment), and SRR/ERR (Run) accessions.

faq.question: Can it download full papers?
faq.answer: It downloads open access papers from preprint servers, Europe PMC, and Unpaywall. Paywalled papers cannot be downloaded.

faq.question: What is single-cell technology ID?
faq.answer: SRAgent identifies library preparation technologies like 10X Genomics Chromium, Smart-seq2, Drop-seq, and others from experiment metadata.

faq.question: How do I process many accessions?
faq.answer: Create a CSV file with an 'accession' column and use the papers command with --max-concurrency to control parallel downloads.
